availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert H. Armstrong (Mercer County Stable Keeper)

body.p: Salvisa, Kentucky, stable keeper. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph Armstrong and Catharine Armstrong. Married to Mary J. Armstrong. Owned eight enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1850. Stable keeper in Salvisa in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 1, p. 259A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 885.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, Salvisa, p. 120.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, Salvisa, p. 33.
